text: it's hard to believe with seven million
passengers a day that the Shanghai metro
system is barely 20 years old the pace
of expansion has been breathtaking it's
now the world's longest subway network
and with the opening of lines 12 and 16
this week the first to stretch over 500
kilometers
I used to take the bus this man says
that took ages but this is great so that
I don't they this new line saves me half
an hour on my normal journey this man
says I'm really happy so as of this week
Shanghai now has 567 kilometers of
operational track leaving London
languishing with a mere 400 and New York
even further behind with just 330
kilometers or so and in the game of my
metros bigger than yours China looks
likely to remain the undisputed champion
the Beijing Metro is now the world's
second longest 16 Chinese cities already
have subway systems and at least 18 more
have begun construction if nothing else
it's a sign that there's little let up
in big government spending despite all
the talk of the need to rebalance this
economy this week Shanghai also
announced a ban on passengers eating on
board but the appetite for growth is
undiminished in the next few years yet
another 230 kilometers will be added
more than the total length of the Paris
Metro John Sud worth BBC News Shanghai
